decks.notes: The Sultai Control deck focuses on utilizing a variety of control elements such as removal, hand disruption, card advantage, and powerful threats to outvalue and outlast opponents. The deck features a mix of planeswalkers, creatures, and spells to control the game and ultimately win through a combination of card advantage and powerful creatures like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and The Scarab God. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing its own powerful board presence to secure victory.

The deck focuses on playing low-cost Spirit creatures to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with flying creatures. By utilizing cards like Spell Queller and Selfless Spirit, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own creatures. Cards like Curious Obsession and Staggering Insight provide card draw and additional damage to close out games quickly. The deck's synergy between its Spirit creatures and flying lords like Empyrean Eagle create a fast and aggressive strategy that can be difficult to deal with for slower opponents.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the combo of Lotus Field, Fae of Wishes, and Underworld Breach to generate a large amount of mana and utilize it to cast powerful spells and win the game quickly. The deck includes cards that can untap Lotus Field or provide additional mana acceleration, as well as card draw and selection to find the combo pieces efficiently. The strategy revolves around setting up the combo as quickly as possible while disrupting the opponent's game plan to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures like Rakdos Cackler and Firedrinker Satyr, and pumping them up with cards like Ghor-Clan Rampager and Anax, Hardened in the Forge. Atarka's Command provides additional reach and flexibility, while cards like Reckless Bushwhacker and Gallia of the Endless Dance help maintain momentum. The mana base is optimized for quick and efficient casting of creatures and burn spells. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and finish the game quickly.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents with a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize, removal spells like Fatal Push and Dreadbore, and versatile cards like Kolaghan's Command. The deck also utilizes powerful threats like Chandra, Torch of Defiance, Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger, and Glorybringer to close out the game. With a mix of control elements and aggressive threats, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure on multiple fronts to secure victory.

The main focus of this Dimir Inverter deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with key cards, such as Jace, Wielder of Mysteries, Thassa's Oracle, and Inverter of Truth, in order to win the game through a combo finish. Utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Thought Erasure to disrupt the opponent's strategy, the deck aims to control the board and draw cards efficiently with Dig Through Time and Opt. The mana base is built with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistent access to the right colors of mana.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on maximizing +1/+1 counters and synergies between creatures, planeswalkers, and lands. By utilizing cards like Hardened Scales, Winding Constrictor, and Rishkar, Peema Renegade, the deck is able to generate powerful creatures quickly. Nissa, Voice of Zendikar provides additional support by creating plant tokens and adding counters. Efficient creatures like Walking Ballista and Voracious Hydra help control the board, while Scrapheap Scrounger provides recursion. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and resilient creature-based strategy, making use of powerful lands like Mutavault and Hashep Oasis for added versatility.

The main focus of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly flood the board with creatures, utilizing mana ramp from Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic to play powerful cards like Catacomb Sifter and Woe Strider. The deck aims to generate value from sacrificing creatures with abilities like Zulaport Cutthroat and Priest of Forgotten Gods, while also utilizing Collected Company and Gruesome Menagerie to recover from board wipes or generate extra aggression. By sacrificing creatures and generating tokens, this deck can overwhelm opponents with a combination of creature swarm and drain effects.

The main focus of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly build a strong board presence by playing efficient and powerful creatures such as Steel Leaf Champion, Rotting Regisaur, and Lovestruck Beast. Utilizing cards like Collected Company and The Great Henge to generate card advantage and mana ramp, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of fast aggression and resilient threats. Additionally, the inclusion of Ghalta, Primal Hunger as a finisher provides a strong late-game option to close out matches.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents' strategies and controlling the board through removal spells, hand disruption, and versatile threats. It aims to outvalue opponents by generating card advantage with cards like Traverse the Ulvenwald and Tireless Tracker, while also having a resilient mana base with a mix of lands that can produce colored mana. The deck is capable of adapting to different situations and can grind out wins through incremental advantages and resource management.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's hand and board while generating card advantage through draw spells and planeswalkers. The deck leverages powerful removal spells such as Fatal Push, Vraska's Contempt, and Dreadbore to deal with threats efficiently. Additionally, the deck includes hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Agonizing Remorse to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The plan is to grind out the opponent with incremental advantage until a win condition like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger or Chandra, Flamecaller can finish the game.

The deck focuses on combining key pieces such as Kethis, the Hidden Hand, and Lazav, the Multifarious, to generate a powerful engine that can quickly mill through the deck and win the game through a combo finish. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Diligent Excavator provide additional synergy and card advantage, while cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Liliana, the Last Hope offer disruption and protection for the combo. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure victory in a 1 vs 1 match.

The deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay, utilizing low-cost creatures and spells to deal damage quickly. By utilizing buffs like Boros Charm and Titan's Strength, alongside protection spells like Gods Willing, the deck aims to keep its creatures on the board while pressuring the opponent. Feather, the Redeemed acts as a key card in maintaining card advantage and recurring spells from the graveyard. With a strong emphasis on combat tricks and efficient creatures, the deck looks to overwhelm the opponent early in the game before they can establish their own strategies.

This deck aims to utilize Fires of Invention to cast powerful planeswalkers and board wipes for control over the game. It also includes Fae of Wishes for additional flexibility and access to sideboard cards. The key strategy revolves around locking down opponents with Teferi and other powerful planeswalkers, while maintaining board presence with creatures like Gideon of the Trials and Heart of Kiran. The combination of powerful planeswalkers and board wipes allows for a strong control game plan that can outvalue and outlast opponents in a long game.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to control the board through counterspells, removal, and board wipes while generating card advantage through card draw and planeswalker abilities. By using a combination of powerful cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Absorb, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in a longer game. The deck also includes win conditions like Torrential Gearhulk and Elspeth, Sun's Champion to close out games once the opponent's resources have been depleted. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and establish control of the battlefield.

Utilizing a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive spells, this Mono Black Aggro deck aims to apply early pressure on the opponent while also controlling the board with targeted removal and discard spells. With a focus on aggressive creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Scrapheap Scrounger, as well as resilient threats like Murderous Rider and Spawn of Mayhem, this deck seeks to establish a dominant board presence and close out the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize. Overall, the deck prioritizes speed and consistency in order to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory.
